productDescription: A shortage of storage space shouldn’t prohibit you from the convenience of an electric kettle. With the 1-liter design of the Hamilton Beach Compact Glass Kettle, it’s quick and easy to enjoy tea, pour-over coffee, hot chocolate, soups and more in minutes, without compromising valuable counter space. Plus, it has an attractive design that looks great in any kitchen.

When the water reaches a boil, the kettle will automatically turn off, which helps keep it from boiling dry. The kettle lifts right off the base without the cord, making serving at the table a snap. A stay-cool handle, push-button lid and easy-pour spout makes filling and serving easy, maximizing the functionality of this powerful but space-saving kettle.

A convenient cord wrap below the base keeps the power cord neatly tucked away.
An anti-scale mesh filter around the lip of the kettle is removable, allowing for easy cleaning.
Measurements are labeled on the side of the kettle for quick reference when precise amounts of water are needed.

reviews.reviewText:
Lots of little features that show there was someone really smart working on the design of this product. E.g., the top of the carafe, when opened fully, clicks and stays open ... when you first take this out of the box the cord must be unwrapped from inside the base, but you can easily choose to unwrap it to either a 12” or 24” length, whichever works for you. All-glass carafe which, as far as I can tell, is somehow annealed to the stainless heating base without any noticeable exposure to plastic or sealant. The top of the carafe is plastic, rather like a typical coffee maker, meaning there is minimal contact with plastic. A filter pops down when the carafe lid is lowered (a nylon-type mesh with a plastic rim), in case the (typical/normal) lime deposits happen to flake off when you pour. The carafe’s opening is just wide enough to get your hand inside (except if you have a huge hand) for cleaning. It should ONLY be used to boil water. Minimum mark is 0.5 L, max is 1.0 L. I suspect I will be trying it with less than 0.5L (don’t tell anyone) since it has an automatic shutoff mechanism if it boils dry ... which should never happen anyway because about 10 seconds after it reaches maximum boil it shuts itself off. To boil 0.7L of water to a full boil took 2-3/4 minutes. The huge advantage is that with a glass carafe you can see and stop it when it reaches an early boil if you wish, e.g. for tea, rather than buying a much more expensive hotpot where you specify the end-point temperature. The small base can remain plugged in when you lift off the carafe to pour the hot water. The carafe’s design is very nice; blue LED light comes on while it is heating up, shuts off when it reaches a boil. I guess they figured we have enough beeps in our kitchens already, this has no beep to signal it’s done — only shortcoming if that’s an issue; I find it boils so quickly that it gives me just enough time to get a mug, prep A french press with coffee, etc that I don’t mind. Note, this is ETL listed. Says very emphatically, “do not immerse in water” so certainly no dishwashing either — not a problem as I can see. Shouldn’t use abrasive cleaners on it; if lime/calcium deposits occur from your water supply, run IT with a bit of vinegar or cream of tartar. Manual says you should unplug this when not in use, perhaps because it’s fairly easy to hit the “power on” lever which is on the bottom of the carafe’s handle. Handle stays perfectly cool even with repeated use, but of course the glass is as hot as whatever is behind it. White markings are only on one side of the carafe, a negative point if you hold it in left hand while filling (I would take a sharpie and carefully draw three little dots...)

One reviewer complained you need to squeeze two tabs to open top of pot... note, that is not needed when pouring only when refilling pitcher, and I have found it not to be too big a problem, no different than every tea kettle or hot pot I have ever had.

I bought this not because I needed it, but because using this will somewhat reduce my carbon footprint, for daily teas and coffees, also if I use it to quickly boil water for cooking (pour the boiling water into a pot on stove, can’t cook in this thing) and it’s faster than a gas stove too. A sort of first step before the expensive plunge into induction cookware. Regardless of why you buy this, if you’re the sort of person who takes delight in nicely designed, styled, and functional items, you’re going to like this. If I encounter any flaws or problems, I will return and edit this, so if you find no notes below it means it’s still working well without problems for me.

Ok folks. Like you, I read the reviews of this product, both positive and negative and am always skeptical. However, some of the negative reviews I was scratching my head. One person commented on the film at the bottom of the pot after use. That's not the pot. That's your water. A simple mixture of dish detergent and vinegar cleans it right up. Another person complained about burning their hand opening the top. Why would you open the top after the water has boiled? You simply pour the water into you cup or tea pot. You should only open the top to put water in the pot. Another person complained of the plastic burning smell. That's a concern but not the case for me. So, with that in mind, here is my honest review. First, this is the second one I've had. I got one as a gift a few years ago and loved it! Then about 2 months ago, I knocked it off the counter and as glass does, it broke. I decided I didn't need the larger pot, as I had, and instead opted for this 4 cup one. Like the larger one, I love it! Unlike a traditional kettle that sits on top of your stove, this automaticly shuts off after the water boils. I don't have to wait and watch the pot boil because we all know a watched pot doesn't boil. :) It is effecient, quick, and does the job. This one is little so if you need more water than 4 cups, buy the larger one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as expected, but why so big?
reviews.reviewText:
Heats water fine and is all glass and stainless where it touches water, so no off plastic taste.

Feels a bit cheap, especially the switch to turn it on. The opening is too small to fit a hand into so you have to have a Sponge or brush with a handle. There is no stay warm option or lower temperature settings like many other models.

The most annoying part, the 1 L carafe is LARGER than the 1.75 L water heater I replaced. It also requires a minimum of 0.5 L to heat which is twice as much water as the previous one. So you can’t heat just a cup of water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tea with a side of cancer?
reviews.reviewText: I NEVER write reviews, but this is serious. The chemical smells this product emits gets into your clothes when pouring water. My shirt smells like burning chemicals. I can’t even imagine what leaches into the water from this. This product shouldn’t be allowed to be sold!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this beautiful tea pot
reviews.reviewText:
I love this beautiful tea pot! It certainly is an upgrade to the traditional tea kettle for the stove. This lights up and has blue lights so is entertaining... I use bottled water in mine because our water is very hard. I really like the built in mesh filter just in case!
The handle stays cool and the outside of the glass gets warm but not super hot. It boils water really fast, has been reliable ( I have owned it for two months and use it just about every day at least once.) It is 1 Liter in size and has a minimum and maximum water level clearly marked on the side of the teapot. If you are serving from it, the tea kettle comes off of the base so you are not dragging the cord behind you. The on and off switch is super easy.. and there is a built in shut off mechanism when the water boils (so you do not have to worry that all your water will dry up and the elements would get ruined.) IT is much faster than the microwave and I like using it because honestly it is powerful and fun!!! 1500 watts of fun! ( I mean power !)
Shipping: I received mine in two business days as I have prime.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the kettle but definitely designed with right-handed people in ...
reviews.reviewText: NOT FOR LEFTYS! Love the kettle but definitely designed with right-handed people in mind. Fill lines are drawn on one-side only, so you have to pick the kettle up with your right hand to see the lines. Minimum fill line and maximum fill line numbers are written in white so are hard to figure out if you pick the kettle up with your left hand to try to fill it. Come on Hamilton Beach! How much more would it have cost to put fill lines on both sides?

reviews.reviewTitle: strange smell of plastic - broke in a month
reviews.reviewText:
strange plastic smell persisted for 2 weeks but functionality’s great and the kettle’s quiet. plus the blue light while it’s running looks pretty dope

update: broke within a month of use - glass shattered when accidentally tipped over on table top after heating water.

I absolutely love this pot and use it all the time. It heats up quickly and shuts off automatically. The first pot I got the switch didn't work, but Amazon replaced it straightaway. I've been using this one now almost every day for weeks and no problems whatsoever. I know one thing for certain, when this kettle takes a digger, I won't hesitate to buy another. It's that nice.

Pros: Heated water quickly the one time I used it.

Cons: Glass carafe cracked on first heating/cooling cycle. Crack is on the back of carafe, so I didn't see it until I went to fill it to use it again. Called the Hamilton Beach 800 number, and hold times were 35 minutes. Submitted a report through their online system on Friday, March 1. They responded Monday March 4 asking for the receipt and the series number.

Pro Tip - the series number isn't on the label where it says "series number", followed by a big blank. It's molded into the plastic of the unit and hard to read.

I responded with the series number and invoice within an hour of them asking. I haven't heard anything in the four business days since then.

I have had it for 17 days, and have spent ten of them waiting to find out if Hamilton Beach will replace the defective carafe. I have a couple more days leeway within the return policy, but I will return it to Amazon for a refund and buy something else if Hamilton Beach doesn't do the right things very soon.

Update: March 12 - Finally received a response, I was told to cut the cord off the appliance, email a photo proving I did that, and after 3-4 days processing for the email/photo, I will receive a new unit within two weeks. They generously waived the shipping and handling charge for the warranty replacement. <sarcasm> The wait continues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Also the lid doesn't like to stay open unless you tilt the kettle back ...
reviews.reviewText: Almost gave it 5 stars, only drawback is I don't care for how the lid opens, you have to squeeze the two tabs on each side which puts your hand above the boiling water. Not a problem if you're careful. Also the lid doesn't like to stay open unless you tilt the kettle back slightly while filling. You don't have to open the lid for pouring though. Overall I like it a lot, time to boil is very acceptable IMO. I recommend it.
Love this thing! I drink tea constantly. It’s super easy to use, heats up extremely fast, no issues thus far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product.Take care to close lid each time.
reviews.reviewText: I like this a lot, but the lid has to be closed tightly or boiling.continues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glass cracked after 8 months of light use
reviews.reviewText:
I loved this kettle! It's affordable, stylish, and heats water efficiently and safely. However, after 8 months of light use (maybe 1x time a week) the glass cracked while heating water. My counter was covered in boiling water and tiny glad shards 😞

I'm very upset about it, as other than this it was the perfect kettle. I reached out to Hamilton Beach but have received no response. Will update if I hear from them.

This thing is bananas!!! Not very often am I blown away by something working really well. Filled with water, plug it in, and the water was boiling in under 3 minutes! If I went with my original idea of a steel kettle on the stove top, i'd be waiting at least another 5 to 10 minutes to hear the whistle.

I was looking for something small and efficient for a couple cups of tea at a time, i definitely found what I was looking for. Awesome product! A+

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't trust aggregate review scores - look deeper
reviews.reviewText: I made the mistake of seeing that this product had a near 5 star review and did not do my due diligence. I cannot believe so many people rated it so high. 1.) There is no temperature selection - my previous kettle had a selection of 175, 190, 200, and 212. This seems like an easy feature. Would also be nice to know what temperature the water is. An small simple LED indicator would have been nice. 2.) The button to open the spout is near the spout which will be hot right after you use it. Most of these kettles have the button on the handle. This seems like a big oversight. 3.) The water does not feel as hot as my previous kettle. It does not cook my oatmeal as well as previous kettle. If these features are important to you, look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cracked after a couple months of use
reviews.reviewText: Bought this kettle. I used it for a couple of months and then it cracked while heating up water.

I drink hot tea a lot and have oatmeal for breakfast almost every morning, so this was a no-brainer. It is SO much faster than the stovetop tea kettle and is easier than the microwave. I love that the bottom of the kettle isn't hot so I don't have to worry about setting it on the countertop, and it's really easy to clean.

I have had this over a year now and it is holding up nicely. I particularly like the blue light while it heats. I find the beep discrete at shut off. The temperature feature is not accurate; when I tested the temperatures they did not match the setting. If this is important to you, take several measurements until you figure out how far it is out and adjust your temperature settings accordingly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems to boil water faster than gas stove top.
reviews.reviewText: I love this kettle so much that I recently bought a 2nd for my son who "borrowed" mine quite often. I love it for quick hot water for tea. He loves his for quick hot water for instant oatmeal. Mine has worked perfectly for 2 years. Reasonably priced and it seems to boil water faster than my stove top kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Please, Hamilton Beach, acknowledge your left-handed customers.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this kettle for my grandmother so she doesn't have to run the whole stove just to heat up water for coffee. I plugged it in and showed her how it automatically cuts off when the water gets hot and she was sold. She uses it constantly. There's just one problem.

She's left handed. That means when she's holding the kettle in what is a normal and comfortable way for her, she will not see the minimum and maximum water level markings on the kettle. And she has overfilled it a couple of times.

Please, Hamilton Beach, go crazy with the luxurious details and PUT THE WATER LEVEL MARKINGS ON BOTH SIDES. Left-handed people everywhere (and those who love them) will thank you.

Design: It’s quite pretty.

Quality: The auto shut-off on my kettle was broken out of the box (yes, the lid was fully closed). Overall the material quality seems like it would hold up for maybe a couple of years.

Safety: When water is boiling, the whole kettle shakes around on the base, which is not something I’ve experienced with any other kettle and is unsettling, especially since it is made of glass. The carafe itself is not solid glass, so boiling water touches whatever adhesive and (plastic? silicone?) o-ring the manufacturer used to fuse the stainless steel heating plate and the glass.

Usability: The opening is big enough that getting a hand inside the kettle to clean it should be no problem for most people. The spout is small compared to other kettles and does not pour quickly or well. It is also quite close to the plastic lid so it is hard to avoid exposing water to plastic when pouring, even with the plastic mesh filter removed. The lid design, which requires squeezing both sides in order to open the lid, is surprisingly annoying. Other kettles I have owned either had a spring-loaded button or a one-finger pull tab for the lid.

Other: The manufacturer put a hard-to-remove sticker advertising the blue LEDs on the kettle. You can’t see this until you buy a kettle and remove it from the box so I am not sure to whom it’s supposed to be advertising. I feel like this demonstrates the overall level of thought and care that the manufacturer gave to this product.
Had to return. Received and wouldn't even work.

Works well, looks nice with the glass and blue lights. Was disappointed that it is not very compact. It’s the same size as most the 1.7 liter ones, just has a lot of unused space for some reason. The lid requires you to place entire hand over top which is dangerous when there is hot steam inside if you want to refill or open it to let the steam evaporate out. That is it’s buggest flaw. Overall good product tho.

I LOVE electric tea kettles. Use boiling several times during the day for all kinds of concoctions. This one has a very small capacity (my fault for not realizing HOW small the amount was). But it is a pain in the neck to fill- you have to pinch the lid to open it; not just use one finger to flip open. It does not STAY open easily either. So only ** for that. The water boils quickly enough- but it takes too long to automatically shut off. I usually hear it boiling - several seconds later it’s STILL boiling!?! I frequently pick it up before it has shut off. Strange. No. Wouldn’t recommend this product. I have had several of these in my life- 8-10? and this is my LEAST favorite. If I hadn’t just moved - expenses! - i would replace.

Took me 4 weeks of research and decide best choice between traditional coffee maker, stove whistling pot, electric tea kettle, percolate coffee maker. All my pros for this beauty are :
1. Save space in kitchen
2. Boil in less than a minute. (45 seconds timed ). You don't get boiling temperature in your cup from coffee makers. so your coffee get cold rapidly specially in winter time when the temp is colder in your house.
3. No need of coffee filters. I simply toss the grounded coffee in it , let it boil 40 secs. and serve it.
4. Perfect size for up to 4 regular cups ( 12 oz ). Not too big, not too small , jus perfect size.
5. No spills, nice blue lighting feature.
6. Easy to clean, no taste of metal added.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lever broken on arrival ; also spout very small
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this for my mother as a safer alternative to boiling water. I liked the idea of the BLUE LIGHT so you would know when it was done. Unfortunately, it didn't work out of the box. When pressing the very cheap clear plastic Power ON lever, it immediately returned to OFF position. It didn't stay down. So the blue light and power would remain ON if I stayed there holding the lever down. Returned as defective item.
I would try another one because of the blue light feature, but I found pouring the water OUT of the glass pitcher to be sub par. They made the carafe spout very small and it makes for a messy pour, especially when trying to pour out the very end of the water. Also, did not like that you had to use two fingers simultaneously to open the lid. It was just awkward. The unit in general was kind of cheapish feeling.
See Colin S review a few days before mine. It was spot on with everything I found too.
Great idea -- blue light. Bad implementation on this one.

Like: The blue glow from the LED’s when heating the water. Dislike: The steam rising and burning my hand when I pour boiling water out of it. Did the manufacturer not test this? They must’ve know this but continued with its manufacture anyway. Simple solution would’ve been to place the handle further down the kettle. Dislike #2: It takes two hands to open the top of the kettle. Another major flaw. Dislike #3: The auto shutoff feature does not work less than two months after use. Major fire hazard. Yesterday I got distracted by a chore while water was being heated. When I returned the water had boiled out of it yet it was still heating. This is unacceptable.

reviews.reviewTitle: A gift and some fun too - a worthy gift
reviews.reviewText: I tried this out before I gave it as a gift. I wanted to know why it was valuable to have set temps . I love mine but it does not have that feature. I also do not drink a variety of tea. I did not find a purpose for myself but the person receiving it has told me how much he appreciated that specific assistance. It works well - looks nice on or off and is quite in its operation. Safety shut off works well so you never have to worry about leaving it plugged in, lift it up off its stand and it auto shuts the electricity off. Great idea for those who tend to forget the little stuff. It is a little heavier than I expected and that was an issue for me. Not for my 28 year old. He enjoys it and wanted to send one to his friend - What more is there to say.. Good Product

I've had this kettle for about a month. It's is great in that I love the quick-boiling of water (much quicker than my gas stove), love the blue light when it's on, the safer auto-off feature, and the cap that clicks & stays open when you want it to. I ordered this one because it's max is only 4 cups and was hoping it would be smaller in size (to use less shelf space). Actually it is a bit larger than another kettle that is made to hold much more so it looks slightly bulky on the shelf. That's why I gave it 4 stars. Some people complained about a plastic odor. Others mentioned the print showing the amount of liquid on the glass being only for right-handed people. This has no odor and I've adjusted to the one-sided print. Overall it seems well made and it works well.

I’m using this in the nursery to heat water to warm bottles. It heats really fast! The water boils within minutes. I don’t want boiling water though, so there has been a learning curve about when to turn it off. I get HOT water in less than two minutes. For someone trying to make tea or something, this boils water way faster than the stovetop kettle. I use this to heat water that I pour into a large mug and then warm bottles in it. It is faster than letting the water run (and doesn’t waste water waiting for it to get hot), and faster and easier than going downstairs to the microwave. I got this instead of a fancy expensive bottle warmer because I will actually use this when we aren’t warming bottles any more.

NICE blue light. But not good quality for heating water. Several times it won't stop heating even the water boils for a long time. This started about 2 months of purchase but happened seldom. Recently, the auto-switch has almost failed but occasionally work.So okay, I will watch it when I boil water. BUT NOW, THE SWITCH HAS FAILED COMPLETELY AND YOU COULD NOT USE IT because when you tap down the switch it will bounce back. I could not bear keeping pressing the switch for it to heat water....

reviews.reviewTitle: Very convenient, easy to clean, quick
reviews.reviewText: I like the glass container, the convenience of water boiling in a little over a minute, and I even like having the ability to keep the lit up while boiling and pouring so it doesn't come in contact with the water AT ALL :)) I've only had it for 3 months to replace a water service. So much easier than a water service. I just bring in a gallon of spring water to work, heat it in the electric kettle, and I've got a nice hot cup of tea or soup or hot chocolate (you name it - the possibilities are endless! Needless to say I absolutely love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Kettle, Heats Fast!!! Love it!!!
reviews.reviewText: This kettle heats the water very fast, from cold tap to boiling in less than three minutes. The instructions call for the kettle to be wiped out after use. My only problem with this is that the opening is small enough to make it awkward to reach inside the kettle to dry the heat plate, and if you do not wipe it mineral deposits can accumulate over time. If you have small hands that will help, but the angle is awkward. A removable lid (or at least if the lid was able to fold back beyond the present 90 degree angle) would make access for cleaning a lot easier on this 1 liter kettle. Otherwise, I give it 5 STARS!

I LOVE this kettle!! Definitely is a keeper!! Boils water way faster than a microwave and stovetop. Takes abt 1 min to boil water at the minimum line & maybe abt 2 mins at the maximum line. After reading some of the bad reviews, I was very skeptical but decided to give it a try... so glad I did. LOVE this product!!

Super fast heat time (and the lights are really pretty), but it leaked all over the place when pouring. I use the Chef’sChoice 681 kettle at home (I've had it for 5+ years, and it is still going strong!!!), but I wanted a cheaper kettle for occasional use at my studio. I returned it and ended up with the Amazon Basics kettle, and it's been 100% fine for the past two months that I've been using it. If you want to splurge though, get the Chef's Choice instead.

Was weary about an electric teakettle, but this is so easy to use. The heat automatically shuts off when done boiling which is a great feature for the forgetful/busy person. The wide lid is easy to fill as well. The water heats up ridiculously fast. I've had it for several weeks and no signs of rust. The only thing I would change is having the option to take off the plastic straining part on lid. I end up opening the lid completely before pouring so as to avoid having boiling water touching the plastic and thus possibly leaching chemicals. Other than that it's pretty perfect.

Great product. I saw it first at my cousins hone. She purchased at a local store, but I'm an Amazon kind girl so I purchased it online. The packaging was carefully done. I use this product just about every morning. It's fast and the water is extremely hot so buyer beware. I would definitely recommend purchasing this product. Oh, I love watching the water boil & the blue light illuminate. Ty

I have an instant hot water dispenser on my sink that was acting like it was about to fail, so I got this after reading how fast it heats water. Once it came in, my dispenser straightened up its act so I took it to the office. It is amazingly fast, pretty to look at, and great for tea, oatmeal, grits, etc. No more cleaning hardened cereals off the microwave walls!

After use, the water was cloudy and filled with sediment ( it had been cleaned before use). After I poured the water out, I noticed a sentiment on the bottom of the kettle. I wiped it with a towel and there was a grey stain as noted in photo. Returned right away.

It’s a lot bigger than 1 liter.
I hoped ot would be more compact than a 1-1/2 liter

First time using a glass kettle. It is fast enough, 500ml boils in 2 minutes, the automatic shut of happens in 2 1/2 minutes.
I did however find its shape a bit inconvenient. You have to bend your elbow quite a bit to be able to pour it and it feels very heavy in your hand while you do it, it is just awkward. Also the top opening is too small in comparison to the body, so when you need to wash the kettle it is pretty burdensome.
Good enough, but would not buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: An electric kettle that does its job--and quickly!
reviews.reviewText:
We were solidly a stove-top kettle family... Until we had a baby. This electric kettle is such a great thing to have around--it boils water SUPER FAST, which is very convenient when it comes time to warming bottles. It also means we can have hot team/instant coffee within a minute or so of starting the kettle (I haven't actually timed it, but it just feels very quick).

The kettle is lit up blue when it is on. Considering the kettle is made of thin-ish glass (it's not dainty, but it's not as thick as, say, a Mason jar), it holds temperature fairly well. It comes with instructions on how to descale with vinegar, and it's super effective (we live in Los Angeles, and even exclusively using filtered tap water, the scale builds up!). Do heed the max fill level because you will have a counter full of boiled-over water otherwise.

It’s a great alternative to boiling water on the stove. I put 1L of water in there and it boils in less than 3 minutes. I haven’t officially timed it, but I put water in, turn it on, walk away and when I quickly come back, it’s already finished boiling. It automatically turns off after boiling which is nice. I looked at many electric kettles and settled on a brand I know. This one is for my house, but I’ve been thinking about getting one for work. When I do get another one, I plan on getting this same kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic chemical free instantly boiled water
reviews.reviewText: Okay, maybe the boiling isn't instantaneous, but it sure feels like it compared to every other method I've used. Absolutely love this kettle. I originally purchased for myself and then went on to buy 3 more for the women of the family. One of those items that makes everything that came before it obsolete and becomes an absolute kitchen essential. Only slight downside is the fear of getting any of the underside of the kettle wet when cleaning with soap and water. It's completely doable with care and entirely worth the ease of boiling water in a container that doesn't expose any plastic parts to boiling water.

Compact, lightweight and easy to use. I like to make 2-3 cups of tea and this size is perfect. The blue light looks pretty when the water is boiling. Remember to clean it after every use to avoid build up. Boil a mix of water and lemon juice or vinegar then rinse.

After scrolling through several options of electric kettles, I decided to give this one a try. I am pleased I did. It heats quickly, has a blue indicator light on the base as to when the water has boiled, and detaches from the heating base. As some reviewers had mentioned, mine does appear to have developed spots on the bottom of the inside. It's not rust spots, so it doesn't bother me. I love it and happy made the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of my all time best purchases
reviews.reviewText: I've had my kettle for about 3 years and can't say enough good things about it. I love that it boils water in 5 minutes, is super easy to start (a flick of the switch), turns off automatically when it has full boiled about 30 seconds, and the cord is attached to the base but not to the kettle, so there is no cord to fight with while you are pouring. I use my kettle for SO MUCH! Sometimes I flick the switch back up once the water is hot, but not yet boiling for times I don't need boiling water. Used in our house for everything: I have a pour over coffee maker and use this to boil the water Tea. Oat Meal. tons of stuff. Yesterday I shut my fridge door and turned around. A pan I had stored above the fridge fell and smashed my water kettle. Needless to say it was a huge mess. No sweat though - at <$30 I'm here on Amazon to buy the replacement. Seriously, this is a great kettle. No need to hesitate.

I had an electric kettle that I used everyday for about a year-and-a-half. I took it for granted then it suddenly broke. It was an Ovente. I bought this Hamilton Beach to replace it. I didn't think much of it until I started to use it. The power switch, or the on-off switch, is in a weird place at the bottom of the handle. The lid is not spring loaded. You have to squeeze two things and pull it up. If you don't get the lid up all the way while pinching the two buttons, the lid falls back down. My old one had a spring-loaded lid with the power switch near the top where your thumb goes. Both those features make much more sense than how this Hamilton Beach is configured. Yes it's cheap. But for something I use many times everyday, I'd rather have a spring-loaded lid in a power switch at the top where my thumb is. And why the blue light? Blue makes me think of cold. They should be red LEDs.

I'm using this kettle daily at the office to boil water for my hot tea. I've got a couple of other electric tea kettles and this one is "short and stout" compared to them, although the base still takes up the same amount of room. It puts off a pretty blue light while it's heating. That drew a lot of attention from my coworkers when I first brought it in. It's actually pretty cool looking. It takes a little over two minutes to heat water to a boil, then shuts off shortly after. The cord coils up neatly underneath to adjust the length. It's a great little kettle for the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality control: Loved it for 2 weeks until lights quit & auto-off failed
reviews.reviewText: I became disappointed in this kettle. For the first 2 weeks it was great: heats water quickly, had pretty lights. But after just 2 weeks using it 2x/day the blue lights started to blink, and now the lights don't come on at all. The kettle also does NOT turn itself off now after it starts boiling, so it has to be watched closely or it will boil itself dry: the auto-off feature has already failed. If you have hard water, the kettle can be fairly loud -- I wipe out all the hard water residue every time I fill it; mineral deposits clean up pretty easily. Interestingly, for the first boil on a new fill of water, the kettle is quiet boiling fresh water while it's still clean. But if you leave hot water in it then boil the same water again later for another cup of tea, it makes a really loud rumbly whooshing sound which seems to be from mineral deposits on the bottom from the prior boil. The noise didn't bother me too much, but if you're in a super quiet office it could be disruptive. The interior bottom is metal, so there is metal and plastic (lid) touching the water. I was pretty happy with it at first, but unfortunately this one has to go back.

The reason this is annoying is that by the time you've tilted it and it starts pouring your thumb/hand is directly above the spout and hot steam rises to burn your skin.

reviews.reviewTitle: Comes with a sticker that wouldnot come off
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle to replace the previous one, from the same company, that worked perfectly for a few good years, just got a bit old and bruised so I decided it is the time for a new one.
The kettle came with a HUGE sticker right on the glass, it would not come off with water and soap, and the glue is apparently very heat-resistant, because the sticker is still there after two weeks of everyday use. The sticker brags about the soft blue light inside the kettle, but you don't get to enjoy it because you cannot see anything inside the kettle because of this stupid sticker.
If it ever comes off, I will update this review and tell you how long it takes!

I saw a few poor reviews but took the chance. Glad I did. This kettle makes water very hot very quickly.
1 Liter is more than I need for a cup of coffee, and 1 cup (measured) boils in less than one minute -- and it is much hotter than 4 minutes in a microwave. (much safer too).
On the note of Safety = when pouring the steam will rise up to your hand, it is hot, obviously. pour quickly or with a 'glove'.

UPDATE been using it now for a couple of months, 6 Stars. Got used to pouring quickly, makes tea - coffee - oatmeal - etc in a snap.
One thing that is useful is to leave a bit of water in it. That is if you need one cup put in a cup and a quarter. The reason is that the water keeps the minerals in solution and makes it so much easier to clean = every once in a while I just swish it around, pour it out and keep using it. No scrubbing required.

I have never owned an electric water kettle before. I shopped around before I settled on this one. It boils one liter of water in about 4 minutes.

There a couple of drawbacks 5hougj. I a still rating this with five stars, but thete are two things I would like to point out. It superheats the water to the most turbulant boil I have ever seen. Also the automatic turn-off lags a bit. It turns off the kettle about a minute after the water gets to that super rapid boil.

reviews.reviewTitle: If your looking to boil water for tea, this is perfect!
reviews.reviewText:
I find myself sitting at my desk for long hours into the night. Nothing is better than having a nice cup of tea, without needing to go to the kitchen. If this sounds like you, then you NEED this product.

The pot comes packaged neatly with instructions inside. The functionality of the pot is super easy. You fill the water to the line and flip the power switch at the bottom of the handle. It's that easy, the rest is automated.

The pot lights up a blue color which is great if your sitting in a dark room. It allows you to see what the status is of your water and gives off a futuristic vibe.

Long story short - Great buy - I use this pot a lot and have had 0 problems.

The headline says it all. It boils water and does it quickly enough. It isnt the largest size and what is interesting is that the maximum fill line brings the water up only about halfway up the reservoir.
The glass reservoir is a pro and a con. The pro is that you can see whats in the reservoir and if any contaminants collect at the bottom, you know when to clean it. The con is relative to a typical stainless steel model I had in the past that kept the water warmer for longer after I finished boiling it in the first place.
A soft blue light illuminates at the base to let you know its working.
For the price of 2 Starbucks drinks, you can have boiling hot water all season long.

I love this kettle. I use it at work to make my tea. It is super fast and shuts off when ready so it doesn't "over boil". You just have to be careful and make sure all the water is out of it when not in use...you don't want mold to form. I pour any left over water out once it has cooled down then either leave the lid open or wipe it down on the inside with a dry paper towel so it dries out properly.

I liked that this item boiled water very quickly, and it isn't that loud. The blue lights are nice, as well. However, it leaks when pouring about half the time, and I can't figure out why. Then I'm left to clean up spilled water. The base also doesn't stay hot for very long after the water is boiled and while it's still plugged in. So, once it's boiled, that's pretty much it and you'll need to re-boil if you want to top off your water. I relegated it to my office where it gets only occasional use. Good thing I didn't get rid of my old one at home.

I absolutely love this kettle! At first I was made fun of for wanting/getting this as I was told we have a perfectly good microwave and stove top. But now 3 out of 4 family members have used it and are all very impressed. Boils faster than the microwave or the stove. Auto shuts off but it boils for while before it shuts off so I normally shut it off myself. Great for tea, soups/ramen and hot chocolate. Nice blue glow when turned on. Wished heating up liquids other than water wouldn't void the warranty because it sure is tempting!

I liked this glass kettle for the time I was able to use it. It was delivered on 2-10-19 and on 2-13-19 the house I was living in caught on fire ( not related to the kettle- faulty wiring in house) pictured is what it looked like after fire. I will buy another one eventually. Worked great, as it was brand new. I gave it all stars because I was happy with it for the time I had it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes, there appears to be plastic in the carafe, not just the lid
reviews.reviewText: There is an o-ring seal in the bottom of the carafe between the glass sides and the steel heating element. This seal appears to be made out of plastic and will come into contact with the water. If you are concerned about heating plastic and drinking water that comes into contact with heated plastic, then buy another carafe.

reviews.reviewTitle: Boil a liter of water in one minute!
reviews.reviewText: I'm impressed that this thing does what it says it will. I have to admit that it makes me cringe to fill the decanter only half way, but in just one minute a liter of water is plenty warm enough to brew tea or make an instant hot beverage. It does take a bit longer to achieve the full roiling boil that shuts off the power, but still impressively quicker than any other method I've previously used for boiling water. This kettle with it's ring of blue LED lights is perhaps the most satisfying thing I currently own.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works faster than a microwave and has fun blue lighting under the bubbles!
reviews.reviewText: Faster than the microwave! I love the blue color. My only complaint is When I open the lid or just pour the water that has just boiled, I faintly smell plastic. Hence the four stars instead of five.Hopefully that will go away as I’ve only been using it two weeks. Meanwhile when I boil water I leave the top lid open now. Maybe the plastic smell is coming from the lid. 1 L is the perfect size for every day use. If you need to boil much more water just boil a second batch because it boils so quickly anyway.

Our old kettle was very stylish. But when you tipped it up to pour, you had to be careful that leaking super heated steam didn't burn your hand. It was also more stylish than practical, and the lids went bad on two of them. HOWEVER, THE HAMILTON BEACH version has a nice, tight fitting lid. No steam leak when you pour. It boils water very quickly. Yes, it looks squat, but it works really great. I don't think I'll be having any future trouble with the lid either.

It leaks all over the counter when we pour it, doesn't matter if you pour really slow or fast there is always a puddle on the counter. I have another model of this in copper color that I bought somewhere else and it is great, that is why I bought this one but this one is a dud. Have to keep paper towel by the cup when we pour.

Kettle was great when I first got it. After about 6 uses it started leaking from the bottom of the kettle, right near the electrical contacts. Not good. Also, the bottom of the kettle is corroding which has been noted here in Amazon reviews previously. I don’t understand why the corrosion appears since the bottom appears to be glass. Sure enough,if you crib it gently the corrosion (rust) comes off. I use bottled water, not tap water, so that’s not the issue. Anyway, it’s trash.

( I found a number to call the company. After explaining my situation they said they will replace the unit, it's good to know a company that stands behind it's products.) I bought this in Oct. it worked great. Today I found a piece of plastic and couldn't find where it came from. After inspection, I found it came from inside the lid. Then I pulled on a piece and it snapped off. I can see I will soon not have a lid. Of course I can not find my paper work to call the company.

I love this kettle. I used to boil water on the stove but it took forever to start boiling and I always had the kettle sitting on the stove. This thing boils water so fast and the blue light is cool. It is easy enough and safe enough for my kids (10 & 12 to use for hot chocolate. I have bought two more since purchasing mine about a month ago, one for work and one as a gift for my mother in law. Highly recommend.

We decided to quit drinking artificially sweetened instant iced tea and switch to brewed iced tea, so I wanted to get a kettle to avoid boiling water on the stove. I liked that this one is small and doesn't take up too much counter space. It is awesome! It boils a liter of water, which is just right for a pitcher of iced tea, in about 3 minutes. It has a cool blue light while it is heating and it switches off instantly (which is good because I have boiled a pot dry on the stove more than once). I definitely recommend this product.

I love how quick this kettle works! I use it exclusively at work so my coworker and I can have piping hot water for our tea or coffee. The blue lights are pretty while its in use and are a nice, silent indicator of when the kettle's done boiling. There's no whistling or noise at all so you can easily set it and forget it, but it automatically shuts off once it reaches boiling so there's no worry there.

Kind of want to get another one for my home use too,,,, maybe for the holidays lmao

I never thought I could love a water kettle, but here I am. This kettle is wonderful. It heats the water quickly and shuts off automatically. I love how I can just pick it up off the base to pour. The blue lights are a great touch. I really cannot think of any negatives about it. Works great. I’m very happy with my purchase.

well if works fast and well. One problematic detail is that the blue light is sometimes blinking as if there was a bad connection, but that is purely esthetic. We shall see how long this will last. Meets expectations.I do like the size. Smaller than most

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, easy to clean, and pretty
reviews.reviewText: I received this tea kettle as a house warming gift and I use it at least twice a day — once to boil water for coffee and once for tea. It is quick and gets the water hot, hot, hot! I am not always good at emptying it out after I’m done and I have hard water so I get a lot of build up in the bottom, but I follow the directions in the user guide to remove it and it works like a dream. Because of the build up, I appreciate the mesh guard at the mouth of the kettle.

Being an avid tea drinker, electric kettles are necessary to support this habit. This particular one is a great value for the price.
I filled it up to the max, 1 liter, and it boiled in about 5min, which is on par with other electric kettles out there. The boiling switch is underneath the handle, and once the kettles reached boiling, it switches itself off. The blue light only comes on while the kettle's heating up, so you'll know when it's done. It's a bit loud for an electric kettle, (alright I admit I'm used to fancy ones) but nothing so bad as a stovetop kettle!
The glass not only looks great, but is the best material for boiling water, as it won't leach chemicals into the water. The top is plastic, but the water is so far away from it, except when pouring, that it's not going to hurt much. There's also a built in filter, should you throw in tea leaves or something. And hey, it's easy to clean with all that glass! I had no issue with odd plastic smells after I washed it (handwash). It fits right on the base, which has a spool to wrap the cord in, so it's not sprawling all over the counter.
As for its compactness...it's only a few inches shorter than my Epica kettle. So not terribly compact I think, but it's certainly a good size to fit on a smaller counter. I'm seriously considering bringing it to work in cubeville.
Hamilton Beach is a pretty solid brand, (I've had to exchange stuff before and they were great) so I expect that this will last for some time. Not forever, but I'll get my $25 out of it. For a decently priced electric kettle this is a wonderful choice!

qAndA.question: Does it beep when you turn it on or when the water has come to a boil?
qAndA.answer: It does not beep when you turn it on and it does not beep when the water comes to a boil. It does not beep at all for anything.

qAndA.question: Where is this kettle made?
qAndA.answer: Did not check. I love it.

qAndA.question: Will not buy when it takes 1-2 months to deliver. Too slow?
qAndA.answer: I got mine very fast. 2 days I think with Prime.

qAndA.question: Is it BPA free
qAndA.answer: It is glass so it must be-good kettle

qAndA.question: Is this hard to clean inside with this small opening? Thank you.
qAndA.answer: No. The opening may be big enough to fit your hand.

qAndA.question: I am getting significant leaking from the spout when I pour. Does anybody else experience this?
qAndA.answer: Not really if I take a little time

qAndA.question: What is the warranty?
qAndA.answer: Think the slip said 1 year. Heck? Who cares, it is so cheap I'll just get another one.
